Executive Assistant Job at Elizabeth Maddeux Limited




        
    

        
        Elizabeth Maddeux Limited - Our client, a leading FMCG manufacturing company in Abuja, is seeking a highly organized, discreet, and proactive candidate to provide high-level administrative and operational support to senior executives in the capacity below: 

Job Position: Executive Assistant
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Description


	The role requires excellent coordination, communication, and confidentiality while ensuring smooth day-to-day executive operations.


Key Responsibilities
Executive Support & Coordination:
     

            
    




	Manage executive calendars, schedules, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Coordinate meetings, prepare agendas, take minutes, and track action items.
	Serve as a key point of contact between executives and internal/external stakeholders.


Documentation & Communication:


	Prepare correspondence, reports, presentations, and briefing materials.
	Screen calls, emails, and requests, ensuring timely follow-up and prioritization.
	Maintain organized filing systems for confidential documents and records.


Administrative & Operational Support:


	Support executives with daily administrative tasks and workflow management.
	Assist in planning and coordinating executive events, visits, and meetings.
	Track deadlines, deliverables, and management commitments.


Confidentiality & Discretion:


	Handle sensitive information with the highest level of confidentiality and professionalism.
	Support compliance with company policies and executive protocols.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of executive schedules and deliverables.
	Turnaround time for correspondence and reports.
	Meeting coordination effectiveness and follow-up completion.
	Executive satisfaction and feedback.
	Confidentiality and compliance with company protocols.
	Organization and retrieval of documents and records.
	Responsiveness to internal and external stakeholders.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Business Administration, Secretarial Studies, or related field.
	Minimum 3 – 4 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or in a similar senior administrative role.
	Experience supporting senior executives in a corporate or manufacturing environment is an advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
	Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	High level of discretion, integrity, and professionalism.
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure.
	Strong interpersonal and coordination skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive Salary: N400,000 - N450,000 / month.
	Training and professional development opportunities.
	Career growth in a performance-driven FMCG Company.
	Supportive team culture and enabling environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: recruit@elizabethmaddeux.com using “Executive Assistant - Garki Abuja” as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

DevOps Engineer Job at CredPal




        
    

        
        CredPal is a leading financial technology company that offers a comprehensive range of financial solutions, including credit cards and investment opportunities, to empower individuals. Our mission is to revolutionize access to credit and investment, enabling individuals to take charge of their financial well-being.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps Engineer

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job Type: Full-Time (Hybrid)
Level: Mid Level
Department: Engineering

Purpose Statement
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled DevOps Engineer to join our team and take a pivotal role in optimizing our AWS Cloud environment.
	As a DevOps Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be developing Terraform modules, Ansible modules, Jenkins pipelines, python scripts, and building secure networks in the AWS Cloud infrastructure.
	You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and automate the deployment and management of cloud-based applications.


Responsibilities


	Implement and maintain automated CI/CD pipelines for frequent and reliable software releases.
	Design, configure, and manage scalable infrastructure in on-premises and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) using infrastructure-as-code tools.
	Create automation solutions to improve efficiency and reduce errors in development and deployment processes.
	Manage configuration tools for standardized and automated infrastructure and application provisioning.
	Set up monitoring and alerting systems for proactive issue detection and system reliability.
	Collaborate with the security team to implement and maintain best practices and ensure compliance with industry regulations.
	Provide support to development teams for building, testing, and deploying applications.
	Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure, deployment, and application performance issues.
	Maintain clear and concise documentation for infrastructure and deployment processes.
	Stay updated with the latest DevOps tools and technologies, proposing continuous improvements for workflow optimization.


Requirements


	DevOps certifications like AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), or similar.
	3-5 Years of experience as a DevOps Engineer, preferably in the FinTech or financial services industry.
	Years of experience administering Linux servers.
	Experience developing engineering applications for a large corporation.
	Experience with infrastructure as code such as Terraform.
	Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible.
	Experience with scripting - Python.
	Working knowledge of databases and SQL.
	Experience with CI / CD pipelines such as Jenkins.
	Experience with Docker / ECS / Kubernetes.
	Experience with git and git workflows
	Good knowledge of network infrastructure design & public cloud architecture.
	Experience with serverless computing architectures (e.g., AWS Lambda, Azure Functions).
	Familiarity with Agile and DevOps methodologies.
	Understanding of software development best practices and version control systems (e.g., Git).


Benefits


	Professional development opportunities.
	A collaborative and inclusive work culture that fosters growth and innovation.
	Opportunity to work with cutting-edge products and technologies.
	Supportive and approachable management team dedicated to your success.
